mandelbrot

Class MandelbrotModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • mandelbrot.MandelbrotModel

  • public class MandelbrotModel
extends java.util.Observable
    The MandelbrotModel class provides the necessary functionality for calculating and accessing the iteration-values and complex distance of a cross-section of the Mandelbrot set
    Since:
    2013-11-15
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jimmy Holm

    • Constructor Detail

      • MandelbrotModel

        public MandelbrotModel(int Width,
               int Height,
               int MaxIterations)
        Create a MandelbrotModel instance.

        The Mandelbrot Model requires some knowledge about the resolution of the set to create, as well as how many iterations it should try to calculate before deciding a point is part of the set.

        Parameters:
        Width - Horizontal resolution
        Height - Vertical resolution
        MaxIterations - Exceeding this many iterations is assumed to mean the point is inside the set. A higher value means greater accuracy, but slower calculations.

      • GetIterations

        public int GetIterations(int X,
                int Y)
        Retrieve the number of iterations in a given (x,y) coordinate of the fractal.
        Parameters:
        X - The X-coordinate, in the range [0, Width[
        Y - The Y-coordinate, in the range [0, Height[
        Returns:
        The number of iterations for a point outside the set, or MaxIterations+1 for a point inside.

      • GetValue

        public double GetValue(int X,
              int Y)
        Retrieve the absolute-square value of the complex point at (x,y) in the fractal.
        Parameters:
        X - The X-coordinate, in the range [0, Width[
        Y - The Y-Coordinate, in the range [0, Height[
        Returns:
        The absolute-square value of the complex point at (x,y) in the fractal

      • PanAndZoom

        public void PanAndZoom(int X,
              int Y,
              double Factor)
        Center the cross-section on a new point in the complex plane.
        Parameters:
        X - The point in the cross-section which describes the new horizontal center point in the complex plane, in the range [0, Width[.
        Y - The point in the cross-section which describes the new vertical center point in the complex plane, in the range [0, Height[.
        Factor - The zoom-in factor; the higher the number the smaller the cross-section is calculated.
